body:
I am developing a package `py-yt` that declares this dependency:

``` Python
    depends_on("mercurial", type="build")
```

and yet fails with this error:

```
$ spack -k fetch py-yt
==> Warning: You asked for --insecure. Will NOT check SSL certificates.
==> Trying to fetch from file:///home/eschnett/src/spack-yt/var/spack/cache/py-yt/py-yt-3.3.1.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /home/eschnett/src/spack-yt/var/spack/cache/py-yt/py-yt-3.3.1.tar.gz
==> Fetching from file:///home/eschnett/src/spack-yt/var/spack/cache/py-yt/py-yt-3.3.1.tar.gz failed.
==> Trying to clone Mercurial repository:
  https://bitbucket.org/yt_analysis/yt
==> Error: spack requires hg.  Make sure it is in your path.
```

Any pointers towards correcting the `mercurial` package to properly provide the `hg` executable are appreciated.
title: "spack fetch" does not have "hg" executable in path
